subject: Re: [junit] simulating textual user input
msgSnippet: So said  sfranklinuk2002  on  2002-09-24 ... Read Adventures in C# on XProgramming.com for another approach that doesn t require worrying about System.in.
messageBody:
So said sfranklinuk2002 on 2002-09-24

>Im trying to write a text based user interface. I can get the output
>from the program and use test cases to prove if the output is as
>expected but...
>
>I now need to simulate the users entry at the keyboard in a test
>case, this needs to be done, by the test class listening to the
>System.in channel, but i cant figure out how to get a test class to
>write to this chanel - to simulate the user input

Read "Adventures in C#" on XProgramming.com for another approach that
doesn't require worrying about System.in. Since C# and Java are
compile-transformable, what works in C# works in Java. Read all the
articles -- they're quite illuminating.
